alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:13PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hot Springs and west central Washakie Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Legend Rock State Petroglyph Site, which is also 18 miles southeast of Meeteetse, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Hot Springs and west central Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Badlands Overlook and Grass Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
